facts.fact: Dogs have an extraordinary sense of smell, estimated to be 40 times better than that of humans.
A dogâ€™s nose print is unique, much like a human fingerprint.
Dogs can understand up to 250 words and gestures, making them as smart as a two-year-old child.
The Basenji is known as the 'barkless dog' because it produces yodel-like sounds instead of barks.
Dalmatians are born completely white and develop their spots as they grow.
Dogs sweat through the pads of their paws, not through their skin.
A Greyhound can run up to 45 miles per hour, making it one of the fastest dog breeds.
The Labrador Retriever has been the most popular dog breed in the U.S. for over 30 years.
